intro: Fissistigma chloroneurum, commonly known as the yellow-veined hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow veins on its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
